page.title: 12Cotswold Stone Quarrying (3)
page.content: Stone is blasted by controlled blasting each day. Both drilling the holes for explosives and the blasting are skilled jobs. On the day we visited the quarry we saw 44 holes 3 metres deep drilled by a tungsten carbide drill. Each hole was filled with a silver "sausage" of Powergel weighing 5kg. This was made of nitrate material mixed with aluminium in a plastic tube. The hole was filled up with stemming dust, a special fine stone dust from the quarry. All the tubes were joined together by "Cordtex" rope and detonated together so that a slice of the quarry face split up. A horn sounded a warning and traffic on nearby roads was stopped while blasting took place. Walling stone which rings when hit is sorted out by hand. 1200 tons are on order at Â£22/ton, waiting time 4 mths.
